titlestmt.titleproper: (Hess) Mary Beth and Richard technical manual collection
Guide to the Mary Beth and Richard Hess Technical Manual Collection M1381
titlestmt.author: Nathan Coy

publicationstmt.publisher: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2017-03-27 08:00:23 -0700.

repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

did.unittitle: Mary Beth and Richard Hess technical manual collection
did.abstract: Contains technical user manuals for products built and sold by the Ampex Corporation, Grass Valley Group, Hewlett-Packard Corporation and other technology firms. Includes manuals, bulletins, catalogs, brochures, and schematics largely concerning the use, maintenance and repair of audiovisual equipment. The manuals have been removed from their original binders, however a representative sampling of binder graphics has been retained.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Stanford University Special Collections holds the Grass Valley Group, Inc. : publications, 1999-2002, M1604 (donated by Richard Hess) as well as the Ampex Corporation Records, M1230. The Archive of Recorded Sound holds the Richard Hess Mullin-Palmer Tape Restoration Project Collection, ARS.0035 [audio transfers assembled by Hess).

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Mary Beth and Richard L. Hess, 2003 & 2015. Accession # 2003-153, 2015-041.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: While Special Collections is the owner of the physical and digital items, permission to examine collection materials is not an authorization to publish. These materials are made available for use in research, teaching, and private study. Any transmission or reproduction beyond that allowed by fair use requires permission from the owners of rights, heir(s) or assigns.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. Note that material must be requested at least 36 hours in advance of intended use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [identification of item], Mary Beth and Richard Hess technical manual collection (M1381). Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Mary Beth and Richard Hess are a married couple that lived in Glendale, California at the time of donation while Richard was employed by National TeleConsultants LLC. In addition to consulting, Richard has worked extensively in audio preservation and owns an audio-related patent. Mary Beth has worked at IBM, in real estate, and with religious and cultural organizations.

Since focusing on audio preservation Richard has contributed significantly to the field of sound recording preservation, especially magnetic media preservation. He has shared his audio expertise through articles and has presented at national conferences for organizations ranging from the Audio Engineering Society to the Association for Recorded Sound Collections. Richard holds U.S. patent 3784746.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Series 1: Ampex manuals, schematics, brochures, and bulletins. Includes individual Ampex catalog numbers.
Series 2: Grass Valley Group manuals, schematics, and bulletins. Does not include item catalog numbers because each system's individual component has a different catalog number within a manual.
Series 3: Miscellaneous manuals, catalogs, schematics, brochures, and bulletins. Includes item catalog numbers when possible.
Series 4: Selected binders for manuals representative of what the manuals, catalogs, schematics, brochures, and bulletins were stored in, including examples of design, typography and graphics.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Series 1: Ampex manuals, schematics, brochures, and bulletins include individual catalog numbers for the manuals. Series 2: Grass Valley Group manuals, schematics, and bulletins does not include catalog numbers as the each item in this series is made up of smaller component part items with their own catalog number. Series 3: Miscellaneous manuals, catalogs, schematics, brochures, and bulletins include individual item catalog numbers when possible. Series 4: Selected binders for manuals do not have catalog numbers and are binders that represent the presentation of the manuals in this collection. Series 4:

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Mary Beth and Richard Hess are a married couple based in Canada. Richard has been heavily involved in consulting on audio topics along with extensive work in audio preservation. Mary Beth has worked in real estate and with religious organizations. Since focusing on audio preservation Richard has contributed significantly to the field of sound recordings preservation, especially magnetic media preservation. He has freely shared information through articles along with presenting at organizations ranging from the Audio Engineering Society to the Association of Recorded Sound Collections.
